text: @EkudYkcin @EnvAgency @KendalSave Absolutely protect the houses from flooding, but try and keep the trees.

@Biginabox @jcreedy @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Oh absolutely. But in this specific example there is no way a developer would be able to build houses on an SSSI like this right on bank of the Lugg, which normally floods a few times per decade. Unless you know different, I'd say it's to prevent their land flooding as much
